parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From kratos; to use strength, i.e. Seize or retain.
Neuter diminutive of pais; a childling, i.e., an infant, or a half-grown boy or girl; figuratively, an immature Christian.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
(Aramaic), girl, little girl. Of Chaldee origin; the fresh, i.e. Young girl; talitha.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (Aramaic) arise, stand up. Of Chaldee origin; cumi.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: To translate (from one language into another), interpret. From meta and hermeneuo; to explain over, i.e. Translate.
A little girl, a young girl; a girl, maiden. Neuter of a presumed derivative of kore; a girl.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
